intro: Psychotria miae, commonly known as the "Mexican Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Psychotria miae is often found in humid, shaded environments such as tropical forests. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both ecological and horticultural studies.
